2023-07-01.name: Summerfest
2023-07-01.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-07-01.name: Petunia Festival
2023-07-01.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2023-07-01.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2023-07-01.summary: There will be lumberjack and magic shows, bands, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2023-07-01.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-01.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-01.name: Riverfest
2023-07-01.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2023-07-01.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2023-07-01.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks.

2023-07-01.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2023-07-01.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2023-07-01.name: Oneida Pow-Wow
2023-07-01.summary: This free family festival near Green Bay features dancing, singing, drumming, indigenous foods and crafts and lacrosse exhibitions.

2023-07-01.name: National Cherry Festival
2023-07-01.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2023-07-01.name: NASCAR Street Race Weekend
2023-07-01.summary: This festival combines music and street racing along the lakeshore and in the Loop. Headliners include Miranda Lambert, the Black Crowes, the Chainsmokers and Charley Crockett.

2023-07-01.name: Canada Day
2023-07-01.summary: On Canada Day at Fort William Historical Park, the continent's largest reconstructed fur post, admission is free to the first 500 visitors. There's also free corn on the cob, an inflatable obstacle course, axe-throwing, paintball, canoe rides, dance performances and bannock-making, log-sawing and lacrosse contests.

2023-07-06.name: Summerfest
2023-07-06.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-07-06.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-06.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-06.name: National Women's Music Festival
2023-07-06.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2023-07-06.name: National Cherry Festival
2023-07-06.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2023-07-06.name: Karl Oskar Days
2023-07-06.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2023-07-06.name: Winnipeg Folk Festival
2023-07-06.summary: This easy-going,  family-friendly festival features more than 70 performers from eight countries, food and hand-made art  from around the world plus a fun play area for children.

2023-07-06.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2023-07-06.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2023-07-06.name: Iola Car Show
2023-07-06.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2023-07-06.name: Hodag Country Festival
2023-07-06.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Martina McBride, Hardy, Locash and Tanya Tucker. There's a band contest, too.

2023-07-07.name: Summerfest
2023-07-07.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-07-07.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-07.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-07.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2023-07-07.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2023-07-07.summary: This easy-going,  family-friendly festival features more than 70 performers from eight countries, food and hand-made art  from around the world plus a fun play area for children.

2023-07-07.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2023-07-07.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2023-07-07.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2023-07-07.name: Hodag Country Festival
2023-07-07.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Martina McBride, Hardy, Locash and Tanya Tucker. There's a band contest, too.

2023-07-07.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2023-07-07.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2023-07-07.name: 80/35 Music Festival
2023-07-07.summary: This indie and jam music festival (named for the junction of two interstates) is at Western Gateway Park.

2023-07-07.name: Blissfest
2023-07-07.summary: This family-friendly folk and roots festival on a farm includes reggae, country, zydeco, jazz and Celtic music on three stages and four workshop areas. There's also a juried arts and crafts fair. Rustic camping is available.

2023-07-07.name: Bigfoot Days
2023-07-07.summary: This town in Chippewa National Forest, between Walker and Grand Rapids, calls itself the Home of Bigfoot. There will be a Bigfoot Olympics, a Bigfoot-calling contest, Bigfoot storytelling, a scavenger hunt and a petting zoo.

2023-07-07.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2023-07-07.summary: This festival features hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, craft and flea markets and sampling at Taste of Marathon County.

2023-07-07.name: Folk Fest
2023-07-07.summary: The music festival in this Upper Peninsula town on Lake Michigan also features food, dance, kids' games and arts and crafts vendors.

2023-07-07.name: Square Roots Festival
2023-07-07.summary: The Old Town School of Folk Music presents this Lincoln Square festival, which includes more than 70 acts on four stages plus 30 local and regional craft beers and food from neighborhood restaurants.

2023-07-07.name: Wild Rice Festival
2023-07-07.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2023-07-08.summary: This festival features hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, craft and flea markets and sampling at Taste of Marathon County.

2023-07-08.name: Phelps Mill Festival
2023-07-08.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts fair, children's activities and music in this bucolic, tucked-away park along the Otter Tail River, next to an 1889 brick and clapboard mill that's open for tours.

2023-07-08.name: Art Fair On the Square
2023-07-08.summary: Nearly 500 artists from around the nation will be selling on Capitol Square and 140 Wisconsin artists around Monona Terrace, attracting more than 200,000 people.

2023-07-08.name: Grand Marais Arts Festival
2023-07-08.summary: This juried art show along the Lake Superior harbor includes children's activities, art demonstrations, a pie social and live music.

2023-07-08.name: Driftless Music Festival
2023-07-08.summary: This free folk and roots festival is in Viroqua's Eckhart Park.

2023-07-08.name: Folk Fest
2023-07-08.summary: The music festival in this Upper Peninsula town on Lake Michigan also features food, dance, kids' games and arts and crafts vendors.

2023-07-02.summary: After a seven-year absence, the free festival returns with food sampling, live music and an art market, this time to Nicollet Mall. Headliners include Third Eye Blind, Uncle Kracker and Big Boi.

2023-07-04.name: Sub Fest
2023-07-04.summary: The fest at the Wisconsin Maritime Museum, home of the USS Cobia, features music, a parade, submarine tours and fireworks.

2023-07-04.name: Fire Over the Fox
2023-07-04.summary: Green Bay hosts the largest fireworks show north of Milwaukee, plus carnival rides, music and family entertainment on five stages plus the Neville Public Museum. It's in Leicht Memorial Park.

2023-07-12.name: Great Rendezvous Celebration
2023-07-12.summary: This festival at Fort William Historical Park is part of 50th anniversary celebrations and includes a historic fur-trade reenactment the second weekend.

2023-07-12.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2023-07-12.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2023-07-13.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-13.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-13.name: Great Rendezvous Celebration
2023-07-13.summary: This festival at Fort William Historical Park is part of 50th anniversary celebrations and includes a historic fur-trade reenactment the second weekend.

2023-07-13.name: Paperfest
2023-07-13.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, human foosball, a firefighter tug of war and 35 bands on three stages in Sunset Park.

2023-07-13.name: Riverfest
2023-07-13.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2023-07-13.name: Rock Fest
2023-07-13.summary: This outdoor festival is near Chippewa Falls. There's onsite camping.

2023-07-13.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2023-07-13.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2023-07-13.name: Bastille Days
2023-07-13.summary: Look for minstrels, cancan dancers, French lessons, a Mardi Gras parade and a 43-foot replica of the Eiffel Tower in Cathedral Square Park.

2023-07-13.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2023-07-13.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2023-07-14.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-14.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-14.name: Great Rendezvous Celebration
2023-07-14.summary: This festival at Fort William Historical Park is part of 50th anniversary celebrations and includes a historic fur-trade reenactment the second weekend.

2023-07-14.name: Fiesta Days
2023-07-14.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2023-07-14.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2023-07-14.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2023-07-14.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2023-07-14.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 87th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2023-07-14.name: Paperfest
2023-07-14.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, human foosball, a firefighter tug of war and 35 bands on three stages in Sunset Park.

2023-07-14.name: Riverfest
2023-07-14.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2023-07-14.name: Rock Fest
2023-07-14.summary: This outdoor festival is near Chippewa Falls. There's onsite camping.

2023-07-14.name: Lumberjack Days
2023-07-14.summary: This music festival along the St. Croix River also features lumberjack shows and such attractions as a downhill derby, hammerschlagen, helicopter rides and a parade.

2023-07-14.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2023-07-14.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2023-07-14.name: Bastille Days
2023-07-14.summary: Look for minstrels, cancan dancers, French lessons, a Mardi Gras parade and a 43-foot replica of the Eiffel Tower in Cathedral Square Park.

2023-07-14.name: RiverSong Music Festival
2023-07-14.summary: This family-friendly festival on the Crow River, west of the Twin Cities, features folk, blues, jazz and other grassroots music on three stages, including one for children. There's onsite camping and food.

2023-07-14.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2023-07-14.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2023-07-14.name: Wannigan Days
2023-07-14.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2023-07-15.name: Grant Park Music Festival

2023-07-15.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2023-07-15.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2023-07-15.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 87th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2023-07-15.name: Paperfest
2023-07-15.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, human foosball, a firefighter tug of war and 35 bands on three stages in Sunset Park.

2023-07-15.name: Riverfest
2023-07-15.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2023-07-15.name: Rock Fest
2023-07-15.summary: This outdoor festival is near Chippewa Falls. There's onsite camping.

2023-07-15.name: Lumberjack Days
2023-07-15.summary: This music festival along the St. Croix River also features lumberjack shows and such attractions as a downhill derby, hammerschlagen, helicopter rides and a parade.

2023-07-15.name: Stockholm Art Fair
2023-07-15.summary: This hamlet on Lake Pepin, a favorite day trip destination for Twin Citians, becomes a shopping mecca during this big fair.

2023-07-15.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2023-07-15.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2023-07-15.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2023-07-15.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2023-07-15.name: Bastille Days
2023-07-15.summary: Look for minstrels, cancan dancers, French lessons, a Mardi Gras parade and a 43-foot replica of the Eiffel Tower in Cathedral Square Park.

2023-07-15.name: RiverSong Music Festival
2023-07-15.summary: This family-friendly festival on the Crow River, west of the Twin Cities, features folk, blues, jazz and other grassroots music on three stages, including one for children. There's onsite camping and food.

2023-07-15.name: Bayfront Reggae & World Music Festival
2023-07-15.summary: Listen to island music on the shore of Lake Superior.

2023-07-15.name: Agate Days
2023-07-15.summary: See the beautiful stones on display, then dig for them at 3 p.m. Saturday during the Agate Stampede, when a load of rocks seeded with 400 pounds agates, $400 in quarters and $100 in 50-cent pieces is dumped downtown.

2023-07-15.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2023-07-15.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2023-07-15.name: Wannigan Days
2023-07-15.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2023-07-15.name: Civil War Encampment and Battle
2023-07-15.summary: This event at Old Falls Village features Lincoln's Gettysburg Address, storytelling and a soldier encampment with medical and cooking demonstration. General Grant narrates the battles, 2 p.m. both days.

2023-07-15.name: Minnesota Scottish Fair Street Party
2023-07-15.summary: This fest features Celtic music, a British car show, a Highland dance competition and a Clan Row.

2023-07-16.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-16.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-16.name: Great Rendezvous Celebration
2023-07-16.summary: This festival at Fort William Historical Park is part of 50th anniversary celebrations and includes a historic fur-trade reenactment the second weekend.

2023-07-16.name: Fiesta Days
2023-07-16.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2023-07-16.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2023-07-16.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 87th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2023-07-19.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2023-07-19.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2023-07-19.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

2023-07-28.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2023-07-28.name: Nordic Fest
2023-07-28.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2023-07-28.name: Sweet Corn Days
2023-07-28.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2023-07-28.name: Riverboat Days
2023-07-28.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates with a pedal tractor pull, duck derby, firemen's water fight and parade.

2023-07-28.name: Pierogi Fest
2023-07-28.summary: This suburb of Chicago exalts the plump Eastern European dumplings, filled with cheese, mashed potatoes or             sauerkraut, with pierogi-eating and -tossing contests, a Mr. Pierogi songfest and a Polka Parade.

2023-07-28.name: National Balloon Classic
2023-07-28.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2023-07-28.name: Taste of Wisconsin
2023-07-28.summary: This free harborfront festival features locally produced specialties as well as cooking demonstrations, gardening workshops and music on three stages.

2023-07-28.name: Coast Guard Festival
2023-07-28.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2023-07-28.name: Prairie Dog Blues Festival
2023-07-28.summary: This Mississippi River festival on historic St. Feriole Island features 12 bands on two stages, with onsite camping.

2023-07-28.name: German Fest
2023-07-28.summary: Look for dachshunds, dirndls and lots of oompah music at this big party at Henry Maier Festival Park on Lake Michigan.

2023-07-28.name: Blueberry Festival
2023-07-28.summary: Eat blueberry pizza and drink blueberry beer while listening to live music and watching dancers and medieval armored combat. There are also pony rides and games for kids.

2023-07-28.name: Waterama
2023-07-28.summary: This festival on the shores of Lake Minnewaska is famous for its lighted pontoon parade on Saturday, followed by fireworks. On Sunday, there's a parade on land, followed by a water-ski show.

2023-07-29.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-07-29.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-07-29.name: Chinatown Summer Fair
2023-07-29.summary: There's a Lion Dance, Chinese  classical dance and music, demonstrations of martial arts and displays  of ancient art forms and disciplines plus a  petting zoo and pony rides.

2023-07-29.name: EAA AirVenture
2023-07-29.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2023-07-29.name: ArtBike + ArtCar Parade
2023-07-29.summary: Decorated bikes, cars and one Couchmobile will circle Lake Harriet at 6 p.m. Everyone is welcome to bring a decorated conveyance and join the parade; meet at 5 p.m. at the Rose Garden.

2023-07-29.name: German Fest
2023-07-29.summary: Look for dachshunds, dirndls and lots of oompah music at this big party at Henry Maier Festival Park on Lake Michigan.
